00001 /**
00002  * \file Geodesic.cpp
00003  * \brief Implementation for GeographicLib::Geodesic class
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * This is a reformulation of the geodesic problem.  The notation is as
00010  * follows:
00011  * - at a general point (no suffix or 1 or 2 as suffix)
00012  *   - phi = latitude
00013  *   - beta = latitude on auxiliary sphere
00014  *   - omega = longitude on auxiliary sphere
00015  *   - lambda = longitude
00016  *   - alpha = azimuth of great circle
00017  *   - sigma = arc length along greate circle
00018  *   - s = distance
00019  *   - tau = scaled distance (= sigma at multiples of pi/2)
00020  * - at northwards equator crossing
00021  *   - beta = phi = 0
00022  *   - omega = lambda = 0
00023  *   - alpha = alpha0
00024  *   - sigma = s = 0
00025  * - a 12 suffix means a difference, e.g., s12 = s2 - s1.
00026  * - s and c prefixes mean sin and cos
00027  **********************************************************************/
00028 
00029 #include "GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp"
00030 #include "GeographicLib/GeodesicLine.hpp"
00031 
00032 #define GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_CPP "$Id: Geodesic.cpp 6905 2010-12-01 21:28:56Z karney $"
00033

00035 RCSID_DECL(GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_HPP)

00039   using namespace std;

00041   // Underflow guard.  We require
00042   //   eps2 * epsilon() > 0
00043   //   eps2 + epsilon() == epsilon()
00044   const Math::real Geodesic::eps2 = sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::min());
00045   const Math::real Geodesic::tol0 = numeric_limits<real>::epsilon();
00046   const Math::real Geodesic::tol1 = 100 * tol0;
00047   const Math::real Geodesic::tol2 = sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::epsilon());
00048   const Math::real Geodesic::xthresh = 1000 * tol2;
00049 
00050   Geodesic::Geodesic(real a, real r)
00051     : _a(a)
00052     , _r(r)
00053     , _f(_r != 0 ? 1 / _r : 0)
00054     , _f1(1 - _f)
00055     , _e2(_f * (2 - _f))
00056     , _ep2(_e2 / sq(_f1))       // e2 / (1 - e2)
00057     , _n(_f / ( 2 - _f))
00058     , _b(_a * _f1)
00059     , _c2((sq(_a) + sq(_b) *
00060            (_e2 == 0 ? 1 :
00061             (_e2 > 0 ? Math::atanh(sqrt(_e2)) : atan(sqrt(-_e2))) /
00062             sqrt(abs(_e2))))/2) // authalic radius squared
00063     , _etol2(tol2 / max(real(0.1), sqrt(abs(_e2))))
00064   {
00065     if (!(_a > 0))
00066       throw GeographicErr("Major radius is not positive");
00067     if (!(_f < 1))
00068       throw GeographicErr("Minor radius is not positive");
00069     A3coeff();
00070     C3coeff();
00071     C4coeff();
00072   }

00074   const Geodesic Geodesic::WGS84(Constants::WGS84_a(), Constants::WGS84_r());
00075 
00076   Math::real Geodesic::SinCosSeries(bool sinp,
00077                                     real sinx, real cosx,
00078                                     const real c[], int n) throw() {
00079     // Evaluate
00080     // y = sinp ? sum(c[i] * sin( 2*i    * x), i, 1, n) :
00081     //            sum(c[i] * cos((2*i+1) * x), i, 0, n-1) :
00082     // using Clenshaw summation.  N.B. c[0] is unused for sin series
00083     // Approx operation count = (n + 5) mult and (2 * n + 2) add
00084     c += (n + sinp);            // Point to one beyond last element
00085     real
00086       ar = 2 * (cosx - sinx) * (cosx + sinx), // 2 * cos(2 * x)
00087       y0 = n & 1 ? *--c : 0, y1 = 0;          // accumulators for sum
00088     // Now n is even
00089     n /= 2;
00090     while (n--) {
00091       // Unroll loop x 2, so accumulators return to their original role
00092       y1 = ar * y0 - y1 + *--c;
00093       y0 = ar * y1 - y0 + *--c;
00094     }
00095     return sinp
00096       ? 2 * sinx * cosx * y0    // sin(2 * x) * y0
00097       : cosx * (y0 - y1);       // cos(x) * (y0 - y1)
00098   }

00100   GeodesicLine Geodesic::Line(real lat1, real lon1, real azi1, unsigned caps)
00101     const throw() {
00102     return GeodesicLine(*this, lat1, lon1, azi1, caps);
00103   }

00106                                  bool arcmode, real s12_a12, unsigned outmask,
00107                                  real& lat2, real& lon2, real& azi2,

00109                                  real& S12) const throw() {
00110     return
00111       GeodesicLine(*this, lat1, lon1, azi1,
00112                    // Automatically supply DISTANCE_IN if necessary
00113                    outmask | (arcmode ? NONE : DISTANCE_IN))
00114       .                         // Note the dot!
00115       GenPosition(arcmode, s12_a12, outmask,

00119   Math::real Geodesic::GenInverse(real lat1, real lon1, real lat2, real lon2,
00120                                   unsigned outmask,
00121                                   real& s12, real& azi1, real& azi2,
00122                                   real& m12, real& M12, real& M21, real& S12)
00123     const throw() {
00124     outmask &= OUT_ALL;
00125     lon1 = AngNormalize(lon1);
00126     real lon12 = AngNormalize(AngNormalize(lon2) - lon1);
00127     // If very close to being on the same meridian, then make it so.
00128     // Not sure this is necessary...
00129     lon12 = AngRound(lon12);
00130     // Make longitude difference positive.
00131     int lonsign = lon12 >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
00132     lon12 *= lonsign;
00133     if (lon12 == 180)
00134       lonsign = 1;
00135     // If really close to the equator, treat as on equator.
00136     lat1 = AngRound(lat1);
00137     lat2 = AngRound(lat2);
00138     // Swap points so that point with higher (abs) latitude is point 1
00139     int swapp = abs(lat1) >= abs(lat2) ? 1 : -1;
00140     if (swapp < 0) {
00141       lonsign *= -1;
00142       swap(lat1, lat2);
00143     }
00144     // Make lat1 <= 0
00145     int latsign = lat1 < 0 ? 1 : -1;
00146     lat1 *= latsign;
00147     lat2 *= latsign;
00148     // Now we have
00149     //
00150     //     0 <= lon12 <= 180
00151     //     -90 <= lat1 <= 0
00152     //     lat1 <= lat2 <= -lat1
00153     //
00154     // longsign, swapp, latsign register the transformation to bring the
00155     // coordinates to this canonical form.  In all cases, 1 means no change was
00156     // made.  We make these transformations so that there are few cases to
00157     // check, e.g., on verifying quadrants in atan2.  In addition, this
00158     // enforces some symmetries in the results returned.
00159 
00160     real phi, sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2, s12x, m12x;
00161 
00162     phi = lat1 * Math::degree();
00163     // Ensure cbet1 = +epsilon at poles
00164     sbet1 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00165     cbet1 = lat1 == -90 ? eps2 : cos(phi);
00166     SinCosNorm(sbet1, cbet1);
00167 
00168     phi = lat2 * Math::degree();
00169     // Ensure cbet2 = +epsilon at poles
00170     sbet2 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00171     cbet2 = abs(lat2) == 90 ? eps2 : cos(phi);
00172     SinCosNorm(sbet2, cbet2);
00173 
00174     real
00175       lam12 = lon12 * Math::degree(),
00176       slam12 = lon12 == 180 ? 0 : sin(lam12),
00177       clam12 = cos(lam12);      // lon12 == 90 isn't interesting
00178 
00179     real a12, sig12, calp1, salp1, calp2, salp2;
00180     // index zero elements of these arrays are unused
00181     real C1a[nC1 + 1], C2a[nC2 + 1], C3a[nC3];
00182 
00183     bool meridian = lat1 == -90 || slam12 == 0;
00184 
00185     if (meridian) {
00186 
00187       // Endpoints are on a single full meridian, so the geodesic might lie on
00188       // a meridian.
00189 
00190       calp1 = clam12; salp1 = slam12; // Head to the target longitude
00191       calp2 = 1; salp2 = 0;           // At the target we're heading north
00192 
00193       real
00194         // tan(bet) = tan(sig) * cos(alp),
00195         ssig1 = sbet1, csig1 = calp1 * cbet1,
00196         ssig2 = sbet2, csig2 = calp2 * cbet2;
00197 
00198       // sig12 = sig2 - sig1
00199       sig12 = atan2(max(csig1 * ssig2 - ssig1 * csig2, real(0)),
00200                     csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2);
00201       {
00202         real dummy;
00203         Lengths(_n, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00204                 cbet1, cbet2, s12x, m12x, dummy,
00205                 (outmask & GEODESICSCALE) != 0U, M12, M21, C1a, C2a);
00206       }
00207       // Add the check for sig12 since zero length geodesics might yield m12 <
00208       // 0.  Test case was
00209       //
00210       //    echo 20.001 0 20.001 0 | Geod -i
00211       //
00212       // In fact, we will have sig12 > pi/2 for meridional geodesic which is
00213       // not a shortest path.
00214       if (sig12 < 1 || m12x >= 0) {
00215         m12x *= _a;
00216         s12x *= _b;
00217         a12 = sig12 / Math::degree();
00218       } else
00219         // m12 < 0, i.e., prolate and too close to anti-podal
00220         meridian = false;
00221     }
00222 
00223     real omg12;
00224     if (!meridian &&
00225         sbet1 == 0 &&   // and sbet2 == 0
00226          // Mimic the way Lambda12 works with calp1 = 0
00227         (_f <= 0 || lam12 <= Math::pi() - _f * Math::pi())) {
00228 
00229       // Geodesic runs along equator
00230       calp1 = calp2 = 0; salp1 = salp2 = 1;
00231       s12x = _a * lam12;
00232       m12x = _b * sin(lam12 / _f1);
00233       if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00234         M12 = M21 = cos(lam12 / _f1);
00235       a12 = lon12 / _f1;
00236       sig12 = lam12 / _f1;
00237 
00238     } else if (!meridian) {
00239 
00240       // Now point1 and point2 belong within a hemisphere bounded by a
00241       // meridian and geodesic is neither meridional or equatorial.
00242 
00243       // Figure a starting point for Newton's method
00244       sig12 = InverseStart(sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2,
00245                            lam12,
00246                            salp1, calp1, salp2, calp2,
00247                            C1a, C2a);
00248 
00249       if (sig12 >= 0) {
00250         // Short lines (InverseStart sets salp2, calp2)
00251         real w1 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1));
00252         s12x = sig12 * _a * w1;
00253         m12x = sq(w1) * _a / _f1 * sin(sig12 * _f1 / w1);
00254         if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00255           M12 = M21 = cos(sig12 * _f1 / w1);
00256         a12 = sig12 / Math::degree();
00257         omg12 = lam12 / w1;
00258       } else {
00259 
00260         // Newton's method
00261         real ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2, eps;
00262         real ov = 0;
00263         unsigned numit = 0;
00264         for (unsigned trip = 0; numit < maxit; ++numit) {
00265           real dv;
00266           real v = Lambda12(sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2, salp1, calp1,
00267                             salp2, calp2, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00268                             eps, omg12, trip < 1, dv, C1a, C2a, C3a) - lam12;
00269 
00270           if (!(abs(v) > eps2) || !(trip < 1)) {
00271             if (!(abs(v) <= max(tol1, ov)))
00272               numit = maxit;
00273             break;
00274           }
00275           real
00276             dalp1 = -v/dv;
00277           real
00278             sdalp1 = sin(dalp1), cdalp1 = cos(dalp1),
00279             nsalp1 = salp1 * cdalp1 + calp1 * sdalp1;
00280           calp1 = calp1 * cdalp1 - salp1 * sdalp1;
00281           salp1 = max(real(0), nsalp1);
00282           SinCosNorm(salp1, calp1);
00283           // In some regimes we don't get quadratic convergence because slope
00284           // -> 0.  So use convergence conditions based on epsilon instead of
00285           // sqrt(epsilon).  The first criterion is a test on abs(v) against
00286           // 100 * epsilon.  The second takes credit for an anticipated
00287           // reduction in abs(v) by v/ov (due to the latest update in alp1) and
00288           // checks this against epsilon.
00289           if (!(abs(v) >= tol1 && sq(v) >= ov * tol0)) ++trip;
00290           ov = abs(v);
00291         }
00292 
00293         if (numit >= maxit) {
00294           // Signal failure.
00295           if (outmask & DISTANCE)
00296             s12 = Math::NaN();
00297           if (outmask & AZIMUTH)
00298             azi1 = azi2 = Math::NaN();
00299           if (outmask & REDUCEDLENGTH)
00300             m12 = Math::NaN();
00301           if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00302             M12 = M21 = Math::NaN();
00303           if (outmask & AREA)
00304             S12 = Math::NaN();
00305           return Math::NaN();
00306         }
00307 
00308         {
00309           real dummy;
00310           Lengths(eps, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00311                   cbet1, cbet2, s12x, m12x, dummy,
00312                   (outmask & GEODESICSCALE) != 0U, M12, M21, C1a, C2a);
00313         }
00314         m12x *= _a;
00315         s12x *= _b;
00316         a12 = sig12 / Math::degree();
00317         omg12 = lam12 - omg12;
00318       }
00319     }
00320 
00321     if (outmask & DISTANCE)
00322       s12 = s12x;
00323 
00324     if (outmask & REDUCEDLENGTH)
00325       m12 = m12x;
00326 
00327     if (outmask & AREA) {
00328       real
00329         // From Lambda12: sin(alp1) * cos(bet1) = sin(alp0)
00330         salp0 = salp1 * cbet1,
00331         calp0 = Math::hypot(calp1, salp1 * sbet1); // calp0 > 0
00332       real alp12;
00333       if (calp0 != 0 && salp0 != 0) {
00334         real
00335           // From Lambda12: tan(bet) = tan(sig) * cos(alp)
00336           ssig1 = sbet1, csig1 = calp1 * cbet1,
00337           ssig2 = sbet2, csig2 = calp2 * cbet2,
00338           k2 = sq(calp0) * _ep2,
00339           // Multiplier = a^2 * e^2 * cos(alpha0) * sin(alpha0).
00340           A4 = sq(_a) * calp0 * salp0 * _e2;
00341         SinCosNorm(ssig1, csig1);
00342         SinCosNorm(ssig2, csig2);
00343         real C4a[nC4];
00344         C4f(k2, C4a);
00345         real
00346           B41 = Geodesic::SinCosSeries(false, ssig1, csig1, C4a, nC4),
00347           B42 = Geodesic::SinCosSeries(false, ssig2, csig2, C4a, nC4);
00348         S12 = A4 * (B42 - B41);
00349       } else
00350         // Avoid problems with indeterminate sig1, sig2 on equator
00351         S12 = 0;
00352       if (!meridian &&
00353           omg12 < real(0.75) * Math::pi() && // Long difference too big
00354           sbet2 - sbet1 < real(1.75)) {           // Lat difference too big
00355         // Use tan(Gamma/2) = tan(omg12/2)
00356         // * (tan(bet1/2)+tan(bet2/2))/(1+tan(bet1/2)*tan(bet2/2))
00357         // with tan(x/2) = sin(x)/(1+cos(x))
00358         real
00359           somg12 = sin(omg12), domg12 = 1 + cos(omg12),
00360           dbet1 = 1 + cbet1, dbet2 = 1 + cbet2;
00361         alp12 = 2 * atan2( somg12 * ( sbet1 * dbet2 + sbet2 * dbet1 ),
00362                            domg12 * ( sbet1 * sbet2 + dbet1 * dbet2 ) );
00363       } else {
00364         // alp12 = alp2 - alp1, used in atan2 so no need to normalize
00365         real
00366           salp12 = salp2 * calp1 - calp2 * salp1,
00367           calp12 = calp2 * calp1 + salp2 * salp1;
00368         // The right thing appears to happen if alp1 = +/-180 and alp2 = 0, viz
00369         // salp12 = -0 and alp12 = -180.  However this depends on the sign
00370         // being attached to 0 correctly.  The following ensures the correct
00371         // behavior.
00372         if (salp12 == 0 && calp12 < 0) {
00373           salp12 = Geodesic::eps2 * calp1;
00374           calp12 = -1;
00375         }
00376         alp12 = atan2(salp12, calp12);
00377       }
00378       S12 += _c2 * alp12;
00379       S12 *= swapp * lonsign * latsign;
00380       // Convert -0 to 0
00381       S12 += 0;
00382     }
00383 
00384     // Convert calp, salp to azimuth accounting for lonsign, swapp, latsign.
00385     if (swapp < 0) {
00386       swap(salp1, salp2);
00387       swap(calp1, calp2);
00388       if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00389         swap(M12, M21);
00390     }
00391 
00392     salp1 *= swapp * lonsign; calp1 *= swapp * latsign;
00393     salp2 *= swapp * lonsign; calp2 *= swapp * latsign;
00394 
00395     if (outmask & AZIMUTH) {
00396       // minus signs give range [-180, 180). 0- converts -0 to +0.
00397       azi1 = 0 - atan2(-salp1, calp1) / Math::degree();
00398       azi2 = 0 - atan2(-salp2, calp2) / Math::degree();
00399     }
00400 
00401     // Returned value in [0, 180]
00402     return a12;
00403   }
00404 
00405   void Geodesic::Lengths(real eps, real sig12,
00406                          real ssig1, real csig1, real ssig2, real csig2,
00407                          real cbet1, real cbet2,
00408                          real& s12b, real& m12a, real& m0,
00409                          bool scalep, real& M12, real& M21,
00410                          // Scratch areas of the right size
00411                          real C1a[], real C2a[]) const throw() {
00412     // Return m12a = (reduced length)/_a; also calculate s12b = distance/_b,
00413     // and m0 = coefficient of secular term in expression for reduced length.
00414     C1f(eps, C1a);
00415     C2f(eps, C2a);
00416     real
00417       A1m1 = A1m1f(eps),
00418       AB1 = (1 + A1m1) * (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C1a, nC1) -
00419                           SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C1a, nC1)),
00420       A2m1 = A2m1f(eps),
00421       AB2 = (1 + A2m1) * (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C2a, nC2) -
00422                           SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C2a, nC2)),
00423       cbet1sq = sq(cbet1),
00424       cbet2sq = sq(cbet2),
00425       w1 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * cbet1sq),
00426       w2 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * cbet2sq),
00427       // Make sure it's OK to have repeated dummy arguments
00428       m0x = A1m1 - A2m1,
00429       J12 = m0x * sig12 + (AB1 - AB2);
00430     m0 = m0x;
00431     // Missing a factor of _a.
00432     // Add parens around (csig1 * ssig2) and (ssig1 * csig2) to ensure accurate
00433     // cancellation in the case of coincident points.
00434     m12a = (w2 * (csig1 * ssig2) - w1 * (ssig1 * csig2))
00435       - _f1 * csig1 * csig2 * J12;
00436     // Missing a factor of _b
00437     s12b =  (1 + A1m1) * sig12 + AB1;
00438     if (scalep) {
00439       real csig12 = csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2;
00440       J12 *= _f1;
00441       M12 = csig12 + (_e2 * (cbet1sq - cbet2sq) * ssig2 / (w1 + w2)
00442                       - csig2 * J12) * ssig1 / w1;
00443       M21 = csig12 - (_e2 * (cbet1sq - cbet2sq) * ssig1 / (w1 + w2)
00444                       - csig1 * J12) * ssig2 / w2;
00445     }
00446   }
00447 
00448   Math::real Geodesic::Astroid(real x, real y) throw() {
00449     // Solve k^4+2*k^3-(x^2+y^2-1)*k^2-2*y^2*k-y^2 = 0 for positive root k.
00450     // This solution is adapted from Geocentric::Reverse.
00451     real k;
00452     real
00453       p = sq(x),
00454       q = sq(y),
00455       r = (p + q - 1) / 6;
00456     if ( !(q == 0 && r <= 0) ) {
00457       real
00458         // Avoid possible division by zero when r = 0 by multiplying equations
00459         // for s and t by r^3 and r, resp.
00460         S = p * q / 4,            // S = r^3 * s
00461         r2 = sq(r),
00462         r3 = r * r2,
00463         // The discrimant of the quadratic equation for T3.  This is zero on
00464         // the evolute curve p^(1/3)+q^(1/3) = 1
00465         disc =  S * (S + 2 * r3);
00466       real u = r;
00467       if (disc >= 0) {
00468         real T3 = S + r3;
00469         // Pick the sign on the sqrt to maximize abs(T3).  This minimizes loss
00470         // of precision due to cancellation.  The result is unchanged because
00471         // of the way the T is used in definition of u.
00472         T3 += T3 < 0 ? -sqrt(disc) : sqrt(disc); // T3 = (r * t)^3
00473         // N.B. cbrt always returns the real root.  cbrt(-8) = -2.
00474         real T = Math::cbrt(T3); // T = r * t
00475         // T can be zero; but then r2 / T -> 0.
00476         u += T + (T != 0 ? r2 / T : 0);
00477       } else {
00478         // T is complex, but the way u is defined the result is real.
00479         real ang = atan2(sqrt(-disc), -(S + r3));
00480         // There are three possible cube roots.  We choose the root which
00481         // avoids cancellation.  Note that disc < 0 implies that r < 0.
00482         u += 2 * r * cos(ang / 3);
00483       }
00484       real
00485         v = sqrt(sq(u) + q),    // guaranteed positive
00486         // Avoid loss of accuracy when u < 0.
00487         uv = u < 0 ? q / (v - u) : u + v, // u+v, guaranteed positive
00488         w = (uv - q) / (2 * v);           // positive?
00489       // Rearrange expression for k to avoid loss of accuracy due to
00490       // subtraction.  Division by 0 not possible because uv > 0, w >= 0.
00491       k = uv / (sqrt(uv + sq(w)) + w);   // guaranteed positive
00492     } else {               // q == 0 && r <= 0
00493       // y = 0 with |x| <= 1.  Handle this case directly.
00494       // for y small, positive root is k = abs(y)/sqrt(1-x^2)
00495       k = 0;
00496     }
00497     return k;
00498   }
00499 
00500   Math::real Geodesic::InverseStart(real sbet1, real cbet1,
00501                                     real sbet2, real cbet2,
00502                                     real lam12,
00503                                     real& salp1, real& calp1,
00504                                     // Only updated if return val >= 0
00505                                     real& salp2, real& calp2,
00506                                     // Scratch areas of the right size
00507                                     real C1a[], real C2a[]) const throw() {
00508     // Return a starting point for Newton's method in salp1 and calp1 (function
00509     // value is -1).  If Newton's method doesn't need to be used, return also
00510     // salp2 and calp2 and function value is sig12.
00511     real
00512       sig12 = -1,               // Return value
00513       // bet12 = bet2 - bet1 in [0, pi); bet12a = bet2 + bet1 in (-pi, 0]
00514       sbet12 = sbet2 * cbet1 - cbet2 * sbet1,
00515       cbet12 = cbet2 * cbet1 + sbet2 * sbet1,
00516       sbet12a = sbet2 * cbet1 + cbet2 * sbet1;
00517 
00518     bool shortline = cbet12 >= 0 && sbet12 < real(0.5) &&
00519       lam12 <= Math::pi() / 6;
00520     real
00521       omg12 = shortline ? lam12 / sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1)) : lam12,
00522       somg12 = sin(omg12), comg12 = cos(omg12);
00523 
00524     salp1 = cbet2 * somg12;
00525     calp1 = comg12 >= 0 ?
00526       sbet12 + cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(somg12) / (1 + comg12) :
00527       sbet12a - cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(somg12) / (1 - comg12);
00528 
00529     real
00530       ssig12 = Math::hypot(salp1, calp1),
00531       csig12 = sbet1 * sbet2 + cbet1 * cbet2 * comg12;
00532 
00533     if (shortline && ssig12 < _etol2) {
00534       // really short lines
00535       salp2 = cbet1 * somg12;
00536       calp2 = sbet12 - cbet1 * sbet2 * sq(somg12) / (1 + comg12);
00537       SinCosNorm(salp2, calp2);
00538       // Set return value
00539       sig12 = atan2(ssig12, csig12);
00540     } else if (csig12 >= 0 ||
00541                ssig12 >= 3 * abs(_f) * Math::pi() * sq(cbet1)) {
00542       // Nothing to do, zeroth order spherical approximation is OK
00543 
00544     } else {
00545       // Scale lam12 and bet2 to x, y coordinate system where antipodal point
00546       // is at origin and singular point is at y = 0, x = -1.
00547       real x, y, lamscale, betscale;
00548       if (_f >= 0) {            // In fact f == 0 does not get here
00549         // x = dlong, y = dlat
00550         {
00551           real
00552             k2 = sq(sbet1) * _ep2,
00553             eps = k2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + k2)) + k2);
00554           lamscale = _f * cbet1 * A3f(eps) * Math::pi();
00555         }
00556         betscale = lamscale * cbet1;
00557 
00558         x = (lam12 - Math::pi()) / lamscale;
00559         y = sbet12a / betscale;
00560       } else {                  // _f < 0
00561         // x = dlat, y = dlong
00562         real
00563           cbet12a = cbet2 * cbet1 - sbet2 * sbet1,
00564           bet12a = atan2(sbet12a, cbet12a);
00565         real m0, dummy;
00566         // In the case of lon12 = 180, this repeats a calculation made in
00567         // Inverse.
00568         Lengths(_n, Math::pi() + bet12a, sbet1, -cbet1, sbet2, cbet2,
00569                 cbet1, cbet2, dummy, x, m0, false, dummy, dummy, C1a, C2a);
00570         x = -1 + x/(_f1 * cbet1 * cbet2 * m0 * Math::pi());
00571         betscale = x < -real(0.01) ? sbet12a / x :
00572           -_f * sq(cbet1) * Math::pi();
00573         lamscale = betscale / cbet1;
00574         y = (lam12 - Math::pi()) / lamscale;
00575       }
00576 
00577       if (y > -tol1 && x >  -1 - xthresh) {
00578         // strip near cut
00579         if (_f >= 0) {
00580           salp1 = min(real( 1), -x); calp1 = - sqrt(1 - sq(salp1));
00581         } else {
00582           calp1 = max(real(x > -tol1 ? 0 : -1),  x);
00583           salp1 = sqrt(1 - sq(calp1));
00584         }
00585       } else {
00586         // Estimate omega12, by solving the astroid problem.
00587         real k = Astroid(x, y);
00588         // estimate omg12a = pi - omg12
00589         real
00590           omg12a = lamscale * ( _f >= 0 ? -x * k/(1 + k) : -y * (1 + k)/k ),
00591           somg12 = sin(omg12a), comg12 = -cos(omg12a);
00592         // Update spherical estimate of alp1 using omg12 instead of lam12
00593         salp1 = cbet2 * somg12;
00594         calp1 = sbet12a - cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(somg12) / (1 - comg12);
00595       }
00596     }
00597     SinCosNorm(salp1, calp1);
00598     return sig12;
00599   }
00600 
00601   Math::real Geodesic::Lambda12(real sbet1, real cbet1, real sbet2, real cbet2,
00602                                 real salp1, real calp1,
00603                                 real& salp2, real& calp2,
00604                                 real& sig12,
00605                                 real& ssig1, real& csig1,
00606                                 real& ssig2, real& csig2,
00607                                 real& eps, real& domg12,
00608                                 bool diffp, real& dlam12,
00609                                 // Scratch areas of the right size
00610                                 real C1a[], real C2a[], real C3a[]) const
00611     throw() {
00612 
00613     if (sbet1 == 0 && calp1 == 0)
00614       // Break degeneracy of equatorial line.  This case has already been
00615       // handled.
00616       calp1 = -eps2;
00617 
00618     real
00619       // sin(alp1) * cos(bet1) = sin(alp0),
00620       salp0 = salp1 * cbet1,
00621       calp0 = Math::hypot(calp1, salp1 * sbet1); // calp0 > 0
00622 
00623     real somg1, comg1, somg2, comg2, omg12, lam12;
00624     // tan(bet1) = tan(sig1) * cos(alp1)
00625     // tan(omg1) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig1) = tan(omg1)=tan(alp1)*sin(bet1)
00626     ssig1 = sbet1; somg1 = salp0 * sbet1;
00627     csig1 = comg1 = calp1 * cbet1;
00628     SinCosNorm(ssig1, csig1);
00629     SinCosNorm(somg1, comg1);
00630 
00631     // Enforce symmetries in the case abs(bet2) = -bet1.  Need to be careful
00632     // about this case, since this can yield singularities in the Newton
00633     // iteration.
00634     // sin(alp2) * cos(bet2) = sin(alp0),
00635     salp2 = cbet2 != cbet1 ? salp0 / cbet2 : salp1;
00636     // calp2 = sqrt(1 - sq(salp2))
00637     //       = sqrt(sq(calp0) - sq(sbet2)) / cbet2
00638     // and subst for calp0 and rearrange to give (choose positive sqrt
00639     // to give alp2 in [0, pi/2]).
00640     calp2 = cbet2 != cbet1 || abs(sbet2) != -sbet1 ?
00641       sqrt(sq(calp1 * cbet1) + (cbet1 < -sbet1 ?
00642                                 (cbet2 - cbet1) * (cbet1 + cbet2) :
00643                                 (sbet1 - sbet2) * (sbet1 + sbet2))) / cbet2 :
00644       abs(calp1);
00645     // tan(bet2) = tan(sig2) * cos(alp2)
00646     // tan(omg2) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig2).
00647     ssig2 = sbet2; somg2 = salp0 * sbet2;
00648     csig2 = comg2 = calp2 * cbet2;
00649     SinCosNorm(ssig2, csig2);
00650     SinCosNorm(somg2, comg2);
00651 
00652     // sig12 = sig2 - sig1, limit to [0, pi]
00653     sig12 = atan2(max(csig1 * ssig2 - ssig1 * csig2, real(0)),
00654                   csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2);
00655 
00656     // omg12 = omg2 - omg1, limit to [0, pi]
00657     omg12 = atan2(max(comg1 * somg2 - somg1 * comg2, real(0)),
00658                   comg1 * comg2 + somg1 * somg2);
00659     real B312, h0;
00660     real k2 = sq(calp0) * _ep2;
00661     eps = k2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + k2)) + k2);
00662     C3f(eps, C3a);
00663     B312 = (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C3a, nC3-1) -
00664             SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C3a, nC3-1));
00665     h0 = -_f * A3f(eps);
00666     domg12 = salp0 * h0 * (sig12 + B312);
00667     lam12 = omg12 + domg12;
00668 
00669     if (diffp) {
00670       if (calp2 == 0)
00671         dlam12 = - 2 * sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1)) / sbet1;
00672       else {
00673         real dummy;
00674         Lengths(eps, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00675                 cbet1, cbet2, dummy, dlam12, dummy,
00676                 false, dummy, dummy,  C1a, C2a);
00677         dlam12 /= calp2 * cbet2;
00678       }
00679     }
00680 
00681     return lam12;
00682   }
00683 
00684   Math::real Geodesic::A3f(real eps) const throw() {
00685     // Evaluation sum(_A3c[k] * eps^k, k, 0, nA3x-1) by Horner's method
00686     real v = 0;
00687     for (int i = nA3x; i; )
00688       v = eps * v + _A3x[--i];
00689     return v;
00690   }
00691 
00692   void Geodesic::C3f(real eps, real c[]) const throw() {
00693     // Evaluation C3 coeffs by Horner's method
00694     // Elements c[1] thru c[nC3 - 1] are set
00695     for (int j = nC3x, k = nC3 - 1; k; ) {
00696       real t = 0;
00697       for (int i = nC3 - k; i; --i)
00698         t = eps * t + _C3x[--j];
00699       c[k--] = t;
00700     }
00701 
00702     real mult = 1;
00703     for (int k = 1; k < nC3; ) {
00704       mult *= eps;
00705       c[k++] *= mult;
00706     }
00707   }
00708 
00709   void Geodesic::C4f(real k2, real c[]) const throw() {
00710     // Evaluation C4 coeffs by Horner's method
00711     // Elements c[0] thru c[nC4 - 1] are set
00712     for (int j = nC4x, k = nC4; k; ) {
00713       real t = 0;
00714       for (int i = nC4 - k + 1; i; --i)
00715         t = k2 * t + _C4x[--j];
00716       c[--k] = t;
00717     }
00718 
00719     real mult = 1;
00720     for (int k = 1; k < nC4; ) {
00721       mult *= k2;
00722       c[k++] *= mult;
00723     }
00724   }

00728   // The scale factor A1-1 = mean value of I1-1
00729   Math::real Geodesic::A1m1f(real eps) throw() {
00730     real
00731       eps2 = sq(eps),
00732       t;
00733     switch (nA1/2) {
00734     case 0:
00735       t = 0;
00736       break;
00737     case 1:
00738       t = eps2/4;
00739       break;
00740     case 2:
00741       t = eps2*(eps2+16)/64;
00742       break;
00743     case 3:
00744       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2+4)+64)/256;
00745       break;
00746     case 4:
00747       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2*(25*eps2+64)+256)+4096)/16384;
00748       break;
00749     default:
00750       STATIC_ASSERT(nA1 >= 0 && nA1 <= 8, "Bad value of nA1");
00751       t = 0;
00752     }
00753     return (t + eps) / (1 - eps);
00754   }

00756   // The coefficients C1[l] in the Fourier expansion of B1
00757   void Geodesic::C1f(real eps, real c[]) throw() {
00758     real

00760       d = eps;

00762     case 0:
00763       break;
00764     case 1:

00766       break;

00792       d *= eps;
00793       c[3] = d*(9*eps2-16)/768;
00794       d *= eps;
00795       c[4] = -5*d/512;
00796       d *= eps;
00797       c[5] = -7*d/1280;
00798       break;

00801       d *= eps;
00802       c[2] = d*((64-9*eps2)*eps2-128)/2048;
00803       d *= eps;
00804       c[3] = d*(9*eps2-16)/768;
00805       d *= eps;

00841       d *= eps;

00942   // The scale factor A2-1 = mean value of I2-1
00943   Math::real Geodesic::A2m1f(real eps) throw() {
00944     real
00945       eps2 = sq(eps),
00946       t;
00947     switch (nA2/2) {
00948     case 0:
00949       t = 0;
00950       break;
00951     case 1:
00952       t = eps2/4;
00953       break;
00954     case 2:
00955       t = eps2*(9*eps2+16)/64;
00956       break;
00957     case 3:
00958       t = eps2*(eps2*(25*eps2+36)+64)/256;
00959       break;
00960     case 4:
00961       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2*(1225*eps2+1600)+2304)+4096)/16384;
00962       break;
00963     default:
00964       STATIC_ASSERT(nA2 >= 0 && nA2 <= 8, "Bad value of nA2");
00965       t = 0;
00966     }
00967     return t * (1 - eps) - eps;
00968   }

00970   // The coefficients C2[l] in the Fourier expansion of B2
00971   void Geodesic::C2f(real eps, real c[]) throw() {
00972     real
00973       eps2 = sq(eps),
00974       d = eps;
00975     switch (nC2) {
00976     case 0:
00977       break;
00978     case 1:
00979       c[1] = d/2;
00980       break;
00981     case 2:
00982       c[1] = d/2;
00983       d *= eps;
00984       c[2] = 3*d/16;
00985       break;
00986     case 3:
00987       c[1] = d*(eps2+8)/16;
00988       d *= eps;
00989       c[2] = 3*d/16;
00990       d *= eps;
00991       c[3] = 5*d/48;
00992       break;
00993     case 4:
00994       c[1] = d*(eps2+8)/16;
00995       d *= eps;
00996       c[2] = d*(eps2+6)/32;
00997       d *= eps;
00998       c[3] = 5*d/48;
00999       d *= eps;
01000       c[4] = 35*d/512;
01001       break;
01002     case 5:
01003       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2+2)+16)/32;
01004       d *= eps;
01005       c[2] = d*(eps2+6)/32;
01006       d *= eps;
01007       c[3] = d*(15*eps2+80)/768;
01008       d *= eps;
01009       c[4] = 35*d/512;
01010       d *= eps;
01011       c[5] = 63*d/1280;
01012       break;
01013     case 6:
01014       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2+2)+16)/32;
01015       d *= eps;
01016       c[2] = d*(eps2*(35*eps2+64)+384)/2048;
01017       d *= eps;
01018       c[3] = d*(15*eps2+80)/768;
01019       d *= eps;
01020       c[4] = d*(7*eps2+35)/512;
01021       d *= eps;
01022       c[5] = 63*d/1280;
01023       d *= eps;
01024       c[6] = 77*d/2048;
01025       break;
01026     case 7:
01027       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(41*eps2+64)+128)+1024)/2048;
01028       d *= eps;
01029       c[2] = d*(eps2*(35*eps2+64)+384)/2048;
01030       d *= eps;
01031       c[3] = d*(eps2*(69*eps2+120)+640)/6144;
01032       d *= eps;
01033       c[4] = d*(7*eps2+35)/512;
01034       d *= eps;
01035       c[5] = d*(105*eps2+504)/10240;
01036       d *= eps;
01037       c[6] = 77*d/2048;
01038       d *= eps;
01039       c[7] = 429*d/14336;
01040       break;
01041     case 8:
01042       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(41*eps2+64)+128)+1024)/2048;
01043       d *= eps;
01044       c[2] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(47*eps2+70)+128)+768)/4096;
01045       d *= eps;
01046       c[3] = d*(eps2*(69*eps2+120)+640)/6144;
01047       d *= eps;
01048       c[4] = d*(eps2*(133*eps2+224)+1120)/16384;
01049       d *= eps;
01050       c[5] = d*(105*eps2+504)/10240;
01051       d *= eps;
01052       c[6] = d*(33*eps2+154)/4096;
01053       d *= eps;
01054       c[7] = 429*d/14336;
01055       d *= eps;
01056       c[8] = 6435*d/262144;
01057       break;
01058     default:
01059       STATIC_ASSERT(nC2 >= 0 && nC2 <= 8, "Bad value of nC2");
01060     }
01061   }

01063   // The scale factor A3 = mean value of I3
01064   void Geodesic::A3coeff() throw() {
01065     switch (nA3) {
01066     case 0:
01067       break;
01068     case 1:
01069       _A3x[0] = 1;
01070       break;
01071     case 2:
01072       _A3x[0] = 1;
01073       _A3x[1] = -1/real(2);
01074       break;
01075     case 3:
01076       _A3x[0] = 1;
01077       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01078       _A3x[2] = -1/real(4);
01079       break;
01080     case 4:
01081       _A3x[0] = 1;
01082       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01083       _A3x[2] = (-_n-2)/8;
01084       _A3x[3] = -1/real(16);
01085       break;
01086     case 5:
01087       _A3x[0] = 1;
01088       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01089       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01090       _A3x[3] = (-3*_n-1)/16;
01091       _A3x[4] = -3/real(64);
01092       break;
01093     case 6:
01094       _A3x[0] = 1;
01095       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01096       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01097       _A3x[3] = ((-_n-3)*_n-1)/16;
01098       _A3x[4] = (-2*_n-3)/64;
01099       _A3x[5] = -3/real(128);
01100       break;
01101     case 7:
01102       _A3x[0] = 1;
01103       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01104       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01105       _A3x[3] = (_n*(_n*(5*_n-1)-3)-1)/16;
01106       _A3x[4] = ((-10*_n-2)*_n-3)/64;
01107       _A3x[5] = (-5*_n-3)/128;
01108       _A3x[6] = -5/real(256);
01109       break;
01110     case 8:
01111       _A3x[0] = 1;
01112       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01113       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01114       _A3x[3] = (_n*(_n*(5*_n-1)-3)-1)/16;
01115       _A3x[4] = (_n*((-5*_n-20)*_n-4)-6)/128;
01116       _A3x[5] = ((-5*_n-10)*_n-6)/256;
01117       _A3x[6] = (-15*_n-20)/1024;
01118       _A3x[7] = -25/real(2048);
01119       break;
01120     default:
01121       STATIC_ASSERT(nA3 >= 0 && nA3 <= 8, "Bad value of nA3");
01122     }
01123   }

01125   // The coefficients C3[l] in the Fourier expansion of B3
01126   void Geodesic::C3coeff() throw() {
01127     switch (nC3) {
01128     case 0:
01129       break;
01130     case 1:
01131       break;
01132     case 2:
01133       _C3x[0] = 1/real(4);
01134       break;
01135     case 3:
01136       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01137       _C3x[1] = 1/real(8);
01138       _C3x[2] = 1/real(16);
01139       break;
01140     case 4:
01141       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01142       _C3x[1] = 1/real(8);
01143       _C3x[2] = 3/real(64);
01144       _C3x[3] = (2-3*_n)/32;
01145       _C3x[4] = 3/real(64);
01146       _C3x[5] = 5/real(192);
01147       break;
01148     case 5:
01149       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01150       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01151       _C3x[2] = (3*_n+3)/64;
01152       _C3x[3] = 5/real(128);
01153       _C3x[4] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01154       _C3x[5] = (3-2*_n)/64;
01155       _C3x[6] = 3/real(128);
01156       _C3x[7] = (5-9*_n)/192;
01157       _C3x[8] = 3/real(128);
01158       _C3x[9] = 7/real(512);
01159       break;
01160     case 6:
01161       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01162       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01163       _C3x[2] = ((3-_n)*_n+3)/64;
01164       _C3x[3] = (2*_n+5)/128;

01173       _C3x[12] = (7-14*_n)/512;
01174       _C3x[13] = 7/real(512);
01175       _C3x[14] = 21/real(2560);
01176       break;
01177     case 7:
01178       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01179       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01180       _C3x[2] = (_n*((-5*_n-1)*_n+3)+3)/64;
01181       _C3x[3] = (_n*(2*_n+2)+5)/128;
01182       _C3x[4] = (11*_n+12)/512;
01183       _C3x[5] = 21/real(1024);
01184       _C3x[6] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01185       _C3x[7] = (_n*(_n*(2*_n-3)-2)+3)/64;
01186       _C3x[8] = ((2-9*_n)*_n+6)/256;
01187       _C3x[9] = (_n+5)/256;
01188       _C3x[10] = 27/real(2048);
01189       _C3x[11] = (_n*((5-_n)*_n-9)+5)/192;
01190       _C3x[12] = ((-6*_n-10)*_n+9)/384;
01191       _C3x[13] = (21-4*_n)/1536;
01192       _C3x[14] = 3/real(256);
01193       _C3x[15] = (_n*(10*_n-14)+7)/512;
01194       _C3x[16] = (7-10*_n)/512;
01195       _C3x[17] = 9/real(1024);
01196       _C3x[18] = (21-45*_n)/2560;
01197       _C3x[19] = 9/real(1024);
01198       _C3x[20] = 11/real(2048);
01199       break;
01200     case 8:
01201       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01202       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01203       _C3x[2] = (_n*((-5*_n-1)*_n+3)+3)/64;
01204       _C3x[3] = (_n*((2-2*_n)*_n+2)+5)/128;
01205       _C3x[4] = (_n*(3*_n+11)+12)/512;
01206       _C3x[5] = (10*_n+21)/1024;
01207       _C3x[6] = 243/real(16384);
01208       _C3x[7] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01209       _C3x[8] = (_n*(_n*(2*_n-3)-2)+3)/64;
01210       _C3x[9] = (_n*((-6*_n-9)*_n+2)+6)/256;
01211       _C3x[10] = ((1-2*_n)*_n+5)/256;
01212       _C3x[11] = (69*_n+108)/8192;
01213       _C3x[12] = 187/real(16384);
01214       _C3x[13] = (_n*((5-_n)*_n-9)+5)/192;
01215       _C3x[14] = (_n*(_n*(10*_n-6)-10)+9)/384;
01216       _C3x[15] = ((-77*_n-8)*_n+42)/3072;
01217       _C3x[16] = (12-_n)/1024;
